sentence.text: ` I sympathise with him because he missed most of pre-season training with an ankle ligament injury .
Many drivers sympathise with the suggestion cars should be kept out of the city centre .
She could sympathize with his chagrin but it was hardly enough to keep him awake at night .
We sympathise with victims in north Belfast , with those in south Belfast last evening , and with the driver of the car who was attacked this morning .
I sympathize because in my little way I grieve too , but over the people in my life I have allowed to die without ever having shown them any particular affection .
But while one can sympathise with Ackerley in his various predicaments , it is difficult to like him .
I also deeply sympathized with George because Lennie had practically spoiled his life yet George never seemed to complain .
` I may not be able to say very much to the mother and her kids , but I sympathise with them so much because of what my own family went through , " he says .
I fully sympathise with you Nick , but your talk of ` young people' is alarming .
If so , you will sympathise with my own feelings when I unearthed my first coin dating from the English Civil War : a Charles I shilling , probably minted in Oxford in 1642 .
At first she sympathised a bit , but basically she thinks it 's because I dare to walk around and look people in the eye -- I 'm too challenging or flirty or something .
I may not sympathize with the bombing .
